publicationStmt.p: Digital edition hosted on http://rickandmorty.newtfire.org and GitHub: https://github.com/dorothealint/Rick-and-Morty

encodingDesc.p: Some small changes to the original transcriptions were made including fixed spelling errors and getting rid of parentheses, brackes, and colons.

body.stage: Open Ext. Rick's Ship in flying through a planet's rings
(Morty is in the backseat, Summer is in the starboard seat, Rick is driving)

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: : (singing) Love. Connection. Experience.

body.stage: (Morty claps)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah Morty

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: : (singing) Come together. With love. connection, experience! [laughter]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : It's my favourite song

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Hahahahaha, yeah

body.stage: (distress beacon alert chimes)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh yeah, distress beacon! [belches] Yeah baby!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : You're excited about that?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : The first rule of space travel kids, is always check out distress beacons; nine out of ten times its a ship full of dead aliens and a bunch of free shit!

body.stage: [Rick makes a sharp turn]
In unison

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Whoa!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Whoa!

body.stage: end unison

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : One out of ten times its a deadly trap, but I'm ready to roll those dice!

body.stage: [Trans. flying toward S.S. Independence]
[Trans. Rick, Morty, and Summer entering corridor]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Seems like something terrible happened here.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah. Cha-ching. Oh yeah, if you find a room full of eggs, don't shy away from it, give one of them a shake. Those facehuggers are worth more than this ship.

body.stage: (Rick is spray-painting a symbol on a closed door)

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Uh, what's that?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : This will make the cops write it up as a looting by the Korblocks.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : That's horrible!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I hear you man, cops are racist.

body.stage: (A door behind them opens with six crewmembers)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, hey! You're alive! Thank God.

sp.speaker: Female Alien
sp.p: : Can you help us? Our planet was taken over by some kind of [pauses] entity! It absorbed the minds of our people!

sp.speaker: Male Alien
sp.p: 1: We didn't notice until it was too late. The people it takes over, they look like your friends, your family, your leaders, but they're not, themselves any more; They're part of It.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : And how do you know it didn't get on the ship with you? Those two ding-dongs seem pretty calm about the whole thing.

body.stage: (Two male aliens are calm and not panting and standing apart from the other four)
(They screech after Rick points at them)

sp.speaker: Male Alien
sp.p: with glasses: Hey! No, no- uurgh!

body.stage: (Morty screams. The other four are assimilated)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Called it.

sp.speaker: All six aliens together
sp.p: : Hello Rick. Long time no see.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Unity!?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Rick?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Grandpa?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh boy. Uh, these are my grandkids, Summer and Morty. Summer, Morty, this is uh, Unity. We sort of used to, uh, date.

body.stage: [intro credits begin]
[Scene's of life on Unity's planet are shown; S.S. Independence lands]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Quite an operation you got going here Une. You're a whole planet now huh?

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : After we broke up, I spend some time wandering through space,

sp.speaker: Unity (Thin suited man)
sp.p: : then I found this world,

sp.speaker: Unity (Large suited man)
sp.p: : where I was better able to focus on my passion for unification.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : You mean stealing peoples’ bodies?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Summer, rude. Why don't you kids run off and play with Unity while Unity and I do some catching up.

body.stage: (four aliens come over to Morty and Summer put a hand on their shoulders)

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Ugh.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Wait! Rick, aren't these people going to barf into our mouths and absorb us?

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : You're guests here on my planet, you're free to be yourselves; I've never been good at disappointing Rick.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Well now I'm going to barf. Come on Morty.

body.stage: [Trans. to garage; Jerry is rooting through shelves]

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Jerry, what are you- what are you doing in here?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : I’m trying to find our weed whacker, ‘cause our weeds are wack, yo.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : But you can’t go in the garage when Rick’s not here.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : I can’t?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Well, he doesn’t like it.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : What’s he gonna do, crash rent-free at his other family’s house?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : What is that supposed to mean?

body.stage: (Jerry stands up and turns to face Beth)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Your dad gets to walk all over us because of your abandonment issues! He’s playing you, shorty.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Oh, stop affecting that stupid hip-hop dialect!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Stop shifting the crosshairs to my ironic urban patois just because your relationship with your father is toe-up from the flow-up.

body.stage: (Gurgling sounds come from below. Beth and Jerry look around)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : What the hell was that?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : (whispering) I don’t know, let’s just leave!

body.stage: (More gurgling. Jerry removes the mat to reveal a hatch in the floor.)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : That is a hatch! Your father put a hatch in my garage!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : You don’t know it was him! [pauses] Anyway, we’re not supposed to be in here!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Obviously, neither is whatever’s gurgling down there.

body.stage: (Gurgling)
[Trans. to Unity’s planet: Rick is approaching a news stand]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : World peace achieved. Nice! A little weird to publish a paper about it for yourself, but hey. So what’s next?

sp.speaker: Unity (Newsagent)
sp.p: : After I become a type-one civilisation, this world will be invited into the Galactic Federation.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, goody.

body.stage: (As Rick walks, Unity switches between people nearby to have a flawless conversation without having to stop what they’re doing)

sp.speaker: Unity (Customer)
sp.p: : From there I’ll have access to countless planets and species.

sp.speaker: Unity (Pedestrian)
sp.p: : One by one, I will unify them, I will become the universe, and I will be what the single-minded once called a god.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : [burps] I like that. Oh, that’s pretty sexy. Hey listen, where can I get a drink around here?

sp.speaker: Unity (Old woman)
sp.p: : Recreational substances were phased out here. There’s no need for escape from the self when your world is one.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Unity, Unity, who am I talking to? I watched you assimilate a whole police station just to get your hands on the evidence locker.

sp.speaker: Unity (Worker)
sp.p: : Rick, when we met I was a young hivemind with the population of a small town. People… change.

sp.speaker: Unity (Busker)
sp.p: : Especially when I change them. I’m sorry to disappoint you, but… I’ve grown.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Hey, listen, I’ve grown too. I have! See, I’ve- I’ve reconnected with my family, right?

sp.speaker: Unity (Police officer)
sp.p: : Hm, why is that I wonder?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Maybe it’s part of getting old. Maybe I just miss being with… a collective.

body.stage: (Rick and Unity start kissing. A crowd forms around them)

sp.speaker: Unity (Crowd)
sp.p: : Yes Rick! Yes! Yes!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh yeah!

sp.speaker: Unity (Crowd)
sp.p: : Yes! Yes!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Wait, wait, stop! H-Hold it! Not like this. We need a hang glider. And a crotchless Uncle Sam costume. And I want the entire field of your largest stadium covered end to end with naked redheads! And I want the stands packed with every man that remotely resembles my father!

body.stage: [Trans. to a mountain being carved into the shape of Morty and Summer’s heads. Morty and Summer are being fanned and eating hamburgers]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Look at ‘em go! So coordinated! What’s your problem? They’re making you into a Mount Rushmore! They made burgers!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Morty, open your eyes! There is no they! These poor people’s’ bodies are being used! They’re a planet of puppets!

sp.speaker: Unity (Fan holder)
sp.p: : I can hear you.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Ugh!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Well, seems like everybody here’s cool with it. Except for all those redheads. They seem like they’re in a hurry to be somewhere else.

sp.speaker: Unity (Clown)
sp.p: : Balloon, Summer? Balloon, Morty?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : No, we don’t want your dumb balloons. We’re bored. Take us back to Rick.

sp.speaker: Unity (Clown)
sp.p: : Now’s… not a good time.

body.stage: [Trans. to Rick in a hang glider and Uncle Sam costume, flying towards a stadium]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh yeah! I want youuuuuu!

sp.speaker: Unity (Stadium)
sp.p: : Go son go! Go son go! Go son go!

body.stage: [Trans. to Earth: Jerry and Beth are looking down the hatch, which is open]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Oh! Real nice! Real nice! How does a man do this without me noticing?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Oh, you know my dad. Once he puts his mind to something…

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : You’re spinning this to his credit?

body.stage: (Gurgling)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : I’m going down there.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Jerry!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Beth, this is my house, which makes this my garage, my secret hatch, my hidden subterranean lair, and my faceless gargler. Now, are you going to keep hating this playa, or are you gonna jack my steed?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Okay, you’re just making stuff up now.

body.stage: [Trans. to Rick, who’s walking out in a bathrobe, panting, to applause]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh my god. Oh my god. [Drinks water]

sp.speaker: Unity (Redheads)
sp.p: : Oh Rick, it was so bad.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : What’s this ‘was’ stuff? I just need to hydrate and then we’re doing that again!

body.stage: (Beta-7’s spaceships arrive from skyward)

sp.speaker: Unity (Redheads)
sp.p: : Oh damn.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Listen, if this is an invasion I gotta sit this one out, but I’ll- I’ll be back to have sex with the survivors.

sp.speaker: Unity (Redheads)
sp.p: : It’s a neighboring hivemind species, Beta-7. Our planet’s maintained a practical alliance for exchange of vital resources. (whispering) So be nice!

sp.speaker: Beta-7
sp.p: : Unity. [pauses] Is it a… bad time? Are all… present lifeforms… assimilated?

sp.speaker: Unity (Man with glasses)
sp.p: : Beta-7, this is my single-minded friend from Earth, Rick.

sp.speaker: Beta-7
sp.p: : Rick… Sanchez. Unity has spoken of you.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : All bad I hope. [laughing]

body.stage: (Rick laughs and puts his hand on the lead Beta-7’s shoulders. All Beta-7 assimilated scream and point at Rick)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Whoa, Jesus Christ!

sp.speaker: Unity (Redheads)
sp.p: : Beta-7, if my allies are a problem for you perhaps our alliance is as well.

sp.speaker: Beta-7
sp.p: : Our alliance is beneficial. When Beta-7 expresses concern it- it’s only … be-because…

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh snap! Powdered neutronium? Amphetetron? You know what I can make with this stuff?

sp.speaker: Unity (Redheads)
sp.p: : Oh… Rick, I- I shouldn’t...

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Come on, it’s not every day that I’m in town! It- it’s for old time’s sake.

sp.speaker: Unity (Redheads)
sp.p: : Uh… Okay, what the hell! We can purify the resin and make fractal dust!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, I was thinking velocitinis, but…

sp.speaker: Unity
sp.p: : Aww, old man Rick can’t party with the whole planet?

body.stage: (Both laugh)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I can do whatever you do and more, baby.

sp.speaker: Beta-7
sp.p: : Hrmm…

body.stage: (Beta-7 leaves)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You know, I think Beta-7 over there is hoping your alliance can be more than practical.

body.stage: (Both laugh)
[Trans. To Rick’s underground lair. Jerry is searching with a flashlight.]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Well, this explains the six thousand dollar electric bill.

body.stage: (Both see Blim Blam chained up to a wall and yell)

sp.speaker: Blim Blam
sp.p: : [Gurgling]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Well. Nice. Real nice. Alien prisoners under the house. Real nice. Nice. Reeeal-

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Goddamn it, stop.

body.stage: [Trans. to Unity’s planet, Summer is in the street on a soapbox with a megaphone]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Wake up people! You have to fight it! You’re under the spell of an evil monster!

sp.speaker: Unity (Man with glasses)
sp.p: : I can hear you.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Yeah! So you keep saying!

body.stage: (She starts slapping the man)

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Summer!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Wake up! You have to have some individuality left in there!

sp.speaker: Unity (Steven Phillips)
sp.p: : Why do you hate me, Summer?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I’m not talking to you! I’m talking to…

body.stage: (She reaches into his pocket and grabs his wallet, and flips over to his license)

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : ...Steven Phillips! Steven! Set yourself free!

sp.speaker: Unity (Steven Phillips)
sp.p: : Summer, before I took over this planet, this man was a registered sex offender.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : ...Yeah, well so what? At least he was himself.

sp.speaker: Unity (M.Biologist)
sp.p: : This woman was a drug addict on the verge of suicide. Now she’s a marine biologist.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Listen Unity, I don’t think my sister’s trying to say that life would be perfect without you. I think she’s just saying that life would be… you know, life.

sp.speaker: Unity (Old man)
sp.p: : I have transformed life here into a paradise. Prostitutes are now scientists. The homeless are now phisosophers.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, phi- phisosophers?

sp.speaker: Unity (Old man)
sp.p: : Philophiluh… phiphophibup...

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh my god. Where did you learn to talk you grandpa-stealing slut?

sp.speaker: Unity (Old man)
sp.p: : I’m feeling… urk!

body.stage: (The man falls down and vomits. All other assimilated in the area follow suit.)

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh man! Let me help all of you guys up!

sp.speaker: Unity (All)
sp.p: : I’m fine!

body.stage: [Trans. to penis-shaped house. Various assimilated are dancing. Rick is on the couch drinking]

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : Do you know what I love about you, Rick? You’re the only single mind I’ve met who really sees the big picture.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You got that right. But… baby, listen. Y-you’re talking about taking over planets and galaxies, you gotta… you gotta just… remember to let go sometimes, you know.

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : I can let go! Hey, look! You see that town across the river? Watch this.

body.stage: (Planes fly past and bomb the town, blowing it all up)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Whoa!

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : Ha ha! Woot!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Whoa! That’s not what I meant!

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : [laughing] It’s okay! It’s okay, I evacuated! I evacuated the town, look!

sp.speaker: Unity (Townspeople)
sp.p: : Hey! Right here! We’re fine!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : [laughing] Oh, that was awesome! My grandkids weren’t in that town, right? A-are my grandkids alive? … H-hey, my drink is empty.

body.stage: [Trans. to street. More assimilated are dancing, though they’re falling over and puking. Vehicles crash. Morty and Summer are running and almost get crushed by falling beams.]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: and Summer: Aah!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Unity, what’s happening?

sp.speaker: Steven Phillips
sp.p: : Who’s Unity? You kids have nice feet. Mind if I take a picture?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Gross, no!

body.stage: (He takes a picture anyway and wanders off)

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I think you’re getting what you wanted, Summer. Something’s happening to Unity.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Do… all of you remember who you are?

sp.speaker: Ron Benson
sp.p: : ...Yeah. My name is Ron Benson. I’m… an electrical engineer. Father of two, and as you can see from my flat concentric nipple rings, I’m a member of this planet’s top race! [opens shirt to reveal ring nipples]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Okay, that’s good! Uh… Don’t focus too much on the last part, but...

sp.speaker: Daryl Jefferson
sp.p: : I’m Daryll Jefferson. I’m a landscaper. And I’ll be damned if that ripple-nipple bitch’s race is superior! [removes shirt] The cone-nipple people will rule this world!

sp.speaker: Ron Benson
sp.p: : You shut your mouth, you dirty knife-nipple bastards!

sp.speaker: Daryl Jefferson
sp.p: : What’d you say to me, you target-chested piece of shit?

sp.speaker: Alien Man
sp.p: : Race war!

body.stage: (The crowd breaks out into fighting)

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Why are you fighting? Can’t you see you’re all the same?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Ah, Summer. Ha ha. First race war, huh?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Way to go, Summer. You started a race war.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I didn’t start it! They’re the racists! I… I merely empowered them to follow their apparently misguided dreams!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Okay, thanks for clarifying! Y- I’ll have a super accurate headstone now!

sp.speaker: Rioter
sp.p: : Hey wait, what race are you guys?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : [pulling up shirt] We’re neither! S-see?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Yeah, take my word for it. We just have regular nipples.

sp.speaker: Rioter
sp.p: : Hey! These two freaks have no race!

body.stage: (Morty and Summer run, and get chased by a gang of rioters, before getting cornered against a wall)

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh, there’s no place like home! There’s no place like home! Remember, Summer?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh…

body.stage: (The two hug)

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : From Dorothy and The Tiny People movie?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : O-oh, yes, yes yes…

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : All the tiny people?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Dorothy, take us away! Take us away!

body.stage: (As the rioters get closer, Unity (SWAT) drops in and surrounds the two, pushing the rioters back. An assimilated drops down and pulls the two into a hovercopter)

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : Hello Summer. Hello Morty.

sp.speaker: Unity (Pilot)
sp.p: : It’s okay! You’re safe now.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : U-Unity?

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : Yes.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, Unity I am so sorry. I didn’t know freedom meant people doing stuff that sucks! I was thinking more of… a choose-your-own-cellphone-carrier thing.

sp.speaker: Unity (Pilot)
sp.p: : Oh, Summer, you did nothing wrong! I’m having fun with your grandpa! Lost a little control. Probably shouldn’t be piloting a hovercopter, nor should I be… running two hundred thousand pediatric hospitals and twelve million deep friers, but hey! It’s not like this planet can take its business elsewhere!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Um… should we maybe stop somewhere and get you a coffee? Maybe splash a little water on your face, or…?

sp.speaker: Unity (Pilot)
sp.p: : No, no, if I wanted to be sober, I wouldn’t have gotten drunk! Wooohoooo!

body.stage: [Trans. to Rick’s underground lair. Blim Blam is chained up, Beth and Jerry are arguing]

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Oh man. I cannot wait. I cannot wait to hear Rick explain his way around this. He is gone!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Jerry, stop! Please, okay, we weren’t even supposed to be down here. If we confront him about this-

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Oh my god! I love this! I love that this is how far you will go for him. You wanna go upstairs, and cut carrots, and watch a lifetime original, above a fucking alien dungeon! Your relationship with your father is psychotic!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Oh listen to you relish the idea that my genius father is a bad person! Step out of your ego for a second and look at this thing! It’s a monster! He might have it chained up so that it doesn’t eat the planet!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Right, because your father’s such an altruist? I once saw him briefly forget the word for humans! He’s probably harvesting this creature’s organs!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : He’s probably racing to cure its space aids!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : He’s going to eat it!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : He’s protecting it!

sp.speaker: Blim Blam
sp.p: : [Gurgles]

body.stage: In unison

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: :Shut up!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: :Shut up!

body.stage: End unison
[Trans. to penis-shaped house, now on fire. Summer and Morty enter.]

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Unity! This place is a mess!

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : Oh, it’s cool! The part of me that’s the cleaning lady is coming on Friday. [gasps] Oh my god! I have a meeting at the galactic federation in an hour. Oh, I’ll never make it! Ah, I’ll push it to next week.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Unity, could you get Rick out here please?

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : He’s… unavailable! He’s-

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Having sex with you, we get it! Gross. Get him out here now.

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : I don’t think he wants to be-

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : (shouting) Grandpa Rick!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : (shouting) Rick! Rick!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : (shouting) I’m gonna tell mom and dad about the gagoo you have locked up under the garage!

body.stage: (Rick stumbles out, topless, wearing an ammunition belt, a mexican hat and pants, a fake moustache and clutching a bottle of beer)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : What the hell… is your problem?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Grandpa, we need to go home! Now!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Fine, geez!

body.stage: (He opens a portal)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : See ya!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Uh, Rick? I think we should all go.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Tend your garden, kids, I’m kinda doing a thing here.

body.stage: (He puts his arms around two assimilated, who cheer and laugh)

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Grandpa Rick, we’re not leaving without you!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh my god [belches] you guys I get it. You’re afraid the big bad hivemind is gonna steal your grandpa away.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Actually, no. I think Unity’s great and you’re a horrible influence on it!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : What?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : This isn’t healthy, Rick! Y- you know you-you’re really up to no good around here. I-at-at this place, you know?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : You and Unity are like… like… leggings and mid-calf boots. You think you’re great together but you’re just bringing out the worst in each other!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, gee, boy Summer, well put. Uh, why don’t we see what Unity thinks. Unity?

sp.speaker: Unity (Shades guy)
sp.p: : I’m just taking a little break from stuff. You know? I need to relax.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, hey, wh-what’s this on the news, guys? L-l-let me turn it up.

sp.speaker: Unity (Todd)
sp.p: : In the news today, this looks a lot worse than it is. We’re… really just having a good time. Karen?

sp.speaker: Unity (Karen)
sp.p: : Thanks, Todd. Up next: Are you a concerned grandchild or just a buzzkill? We’ll tell you how you can really know for sure!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I think you two are a little outnumbered.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Okay! Well, what if you did it for me? What if you came with us as a favour to us… because you love us?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : What? Dumb. Bye.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : But Rick, Summer’s just-

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Summer’s just a hyper-emotional, needy little- what’s the word I’m looking for here… uh- human! It runs in the family! I can tolerate it but I can’t give a crap about it. Take a hike.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Take care of yourself, Unity.

body.stage: (Summer and Morty leave through the portal)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I’m not looking for judgement, just a yes or no. Can you assimilate a giraffe?

body.stage: [Trans. back to Beth and Jerry]

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : You’re the worst!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : No! You’re the worst! You don’t support this family!

body.stage: (The two start yelling over the top of one another)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : All you care about is yourself!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : You think supporting the family is about supporting you emotionally...

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : You’ve got two children being dragged across the cosmos...

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : ...but you’re unsupportable! Because it’s never enough, Jerry!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : ...by your dangerously ill father, and you force me to watch it happen!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : It will never be enough support to satisfy you! And you don’t even know what it’s like…

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Because you’d rather lose them and lose me than lose him!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : …to be afraid of losing anything because you cling and you cling and you cling…

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : And why? Because you’re the child, Beth. You, not me, you!

body.stage: (Blim Blam gurgles angrily and breaks free)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Aaah!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Oh my god!

body.stage: (Both back away. Jerry puts his arm protectively in front of Beth. Blim Blam moves past them and breaks into a cabinet, before pulling out an object and pointing it at the two like a gun)

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: and Jerry: Aah!

body.stage: (Blim Blam pushes the object into his neck)

sp.speaker: Blim Blam
sp.p: : Um, first of all, hello. Uh, my name is Blim Blam the korblok. Second of all, cards on the table: I am a murderer that eats babies and I came to this planet to eat babies. However, I am also carrying a highly infectious disease, that I suppose you could call ‘space aids’ as you put it, and Rick did chain me up so that he could attempt to cure it. At the same time, Rick’s motivation to cure my disease was not to save my life or anyone else’s, but to patent and sell the cure for billions of blemflarks. But you know the reason why I ripped my chains out of the wall? And do you know why I’m never coming back to this planet? Because the two of you are the fucking worst! You both hate yourselves and each other! And the idea that it has anything to do with Rick is laughable! I’d laugh but I’m biologically incapable, that’s how alien I am! And even I’m sitting here listening to the two of you, and being like, what the fuck! So! Good luck with your shitty marriage, and I’m sorry that Rick has to deal with either of you. Blim Blam, out!

body.stage: (He drops the translator and leaves, but quickly rushes back to pick it up again)

sp.speaker: Blim Blam
sp.p: : You know what? I’m taking this.

body.stage: [Trans. to garage. Summer and Morty have returned. Blim Blam pushes at the garage door but can’t open it]

sp.speaker: Blim Blam
sp.p: : How do you- what is this?

body.stage: (Morty activates the garage door opener)

sp.speaker: Blim Blam
sp.p: : Uh, is there a slow setting? Best door ever.

body.stage: (He leaves, flipping the two off with a penis-shaped finger)
[Trans. to Rick, who’s on the couch watching TV surrounded by several assimilated]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Aaah! [coughs] Okay, okay, now make him cry. But happy cry. Now make ‘em all make fun of the blonde one. Now make ‘em all do it on the table! I can’t believe you created a whole show for me. Now cancel it! Okay, now put it back on. Haha! [pauses] Alright, I’m bored.

sp.speaker: Unity (Administrator)
sp.p: : Rick, is there a way for you to call Summer and Morty? I feel bad that they-

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Pfft, screw those guys! Uugh, I’ll be right back. Don’t waste your brain on those weirdos, Unity. They’re no different from any other aimless chumps that you occupy. They just put you at the centre of their lives because you’re powerful and then because they put you there they want you to be less powerful. Never gonna happen though, right?

sp.speaker: Unity (all)
sp.p: : Never.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Never! Back in a flash.

body.stage: (Rick goes into the bathroom, and washes his hands and face)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Best weekend ever, Rick! I agree, Rick! Let’s see how long we can go!

body.stage: (He goes back into the main room. Unity has disappeared, but there are letters everywhere)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Hey Une! You got any more-

body.stage: (He picks up a note and reads it. Unity talks in a voiceover, using the voices of different assimilated for each part)

sp.speaker: Unity (voiceover)
sp.p: : Rick, forgive me for doing this in notes. I’m not strong enough to do it in persons.

body.stage: (Rick starts wandering around town. The entire town is fil'led with letters. He picks up to read some as he goes)

sp.speaker: Unity (voiceover)
sp.p: : I realise now that I’m attracted to you for the same reason I can’t be with you. You can’t change. And I have no problem with that, but… it clearly means I have a problem with myself.

sp.speaker: Unity (voiceover)
sp.p: : I’m sure there’s no perfect version of me. I’m sure I’ll just unify species after species and never really be complete.

sp.speaker: Unity (voiceover)
sp.p: : But I know how it goes with us. I lose who I am and become part of you. Because in a strange way you’re better at what I do without even trying. Yours, and nobody else’s, Unity. P.S. I don’t know where those coal miners were before they got assimilated. You might want to get checked.

body.stage: [Trans. to the Smiths watching TV in the living room. Rick enters from the left]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Hey.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Dad… [clears throat] I… um… Jerry and I were looking for our weed whacker, and found your subterranean lair… and your alien prisoner. And… he got away. And I know I sound like mom but I can’t sacrifice this whole family’s safety just because I’m afraid you’ll leave again, so no more alien prisoners, and, no more subterranean excavation without consulting us.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Okay.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : ...Okay? Y-y-y-y-Okay like you’re gonna quietly teleport somewhere and never come back?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No. It’s your house.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Grandpa Rick! What happened… with Unity?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Who? Oh. Unity. Yeah, well, I mean honestly we’re talking about an entity that thrives on enslavement, you know. It’s not cool. Fun’s fun but who needs it? I’ll be in the garage.

body.stage: (“Do you feel it?” by Chaos Chaos starts playing in the background. Rick enters the garage, looking depressed, and drains his flask before throwing it away. Then he pulls out two bulbs and puts together a metal contraption on the desk. He pulls a frozen alien creature out of the drawers and brings it to life with a flask of chemicals, strokes it while it shrieks helplessly, and drinks the rest of the chemicals. He puts one of the bulbs into the contraption and sticks the alien under it, disintegrating it with a blast of energy, then replaces the bulb and repeats the process with his own head. At the last second, he falls unconscious, dodging the killing blast. The screen zooms out through the open garage door, showing Rick slumped still on the desk through the night and into the morning, even as Jerry shows up, happily weeding the garden and the driveway without noticing Rick.)
[Credits]
[After Credits scene: Rick’s spaceship is outside Beta-7’s main ship. Rick is driving, with Morty in the passenger seat]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Unity! Unity! Unity!

body.stage: (A transmission comes in from Beta-7)

sp.speaker: Beta-7
sp.p: : How can I assist you?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I wanna talk to [belches] Unity. Beta-7, I know it’s in there!

sp.speaker: Beta-7
sp.p: : You’re classified as a hostile entity, and Unity doesn’t want to talk to you.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I know your game, Beta-7, I’ve met a billion of you, you little on-deck in-the-wind shoulder to cry on!

sp.speaker: Beta-7
sp.p: : You are classified as a hostile entity.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Well, you’re just loving this, mother f- this isn’t gonna shape out like you think, pal! Unity’s not into other hiveminds! It’s gonna suck you in and use you up and a month from now I’m going to be making out with all of you in a bunch of red wigs! Unity! Unity! Unity, I know you can hear me! Get out here!

sp.speaker: Beta-7
sp.p: : Weapons systems engaged.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, in your dreams you have weapons systems.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Ugh, Rick, you said we were going to a movie.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : We are, Morty. Alright, Beta-shit-7, you just got saved by the bell, bitch!

body.stage: [Episode end]
